items.title: Netflix Removes Popular Indie Games from Mobile Platform
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Netflix is delisting 22 games, including acclaimed indie titles like *Hades*, *Braid*, and *Katana Zero*, mostly on July 14, with *Hades* leaving on July 1.  
- Many of these games were exclusive to Netflix's mobile platform, risking their disappearance from Android/iOS unless released elsewhere.  
- Netflix is shifting focus toward games tied to its own shows, multiplayer, and kids' titles, aligning with popular downloads like *Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas* and *Squid Game: Unleashed*.

items.title: Hideo Kojima Sees Death Stranding 2 as a Cautionary Tale
items.author: Khee Hoon Chan
items.summary: - Hideo Kojima describes developing *Death Stranding 2* during the pandemic as his toughest challenge, adapting to remote work and rethinking the game's story amid isolation. - The sequel serves as a caution against *digital overconnectivity* and surveillance, contrasting the first game's message of connection. - Kojima aims for players to *apply the game's experience of connection* to real-life interactions post-pandemic.

items.title: Samsung offers $50 credit for preordering Galaxy foldable
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: - Samsung announced an Unpacked event on July 9 to reveal its premium foldable phone lineup, including a likely Galaxy Z Fold 7 and Z Flip 7. - By reserving and preordering, customers receive a **$50 Samsung store credit** (usable on other products) and entry into a **$5,000 gift card sweepstakes**. - The new foldable may feature an **Ultra branding** and improved camera, addressing previous critiques.

items.title: Tesla’s robotaxis operating in a regulatory vacuum
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: - Tesla launched its robotaxi service in Austin, but incidents like driving on the wrong side and unsafe stops have already been recorded. - The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) is reviewing but largely powerless due to regulatory rollbacks and staffing cuts. - Federal and state agencies have limited ability to enforce safety, enabling Elon Musk’s aggressive plan to deploy up to a million robotaxis by 2026.

items.title: Google finally lets Android users put Chrome’s address bar on the bottom
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary: - Google Chrome on Android now allows users to *move the address bar to the bottom* of the screen, improving accessibility on larger phones. - This feature, already available on iOS since 2023, offers *flexibility in browsing comfort*. - To toggle, users can press and hold the address bar or change the setting via the menu.

items.title: Microsoft offers free Windows 10 extended security updates with conditions
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: - Microsoft now allows *free* Extended Security Updates (ESU) for Windows 10 consumers until October 13, 2026, but requires enabling *Windows Backup* and syncing via *OneDrive,* which may need paid storage. - Alternatives include paying $30 annually or redeeming 1,000 Microsoft Reward points. - The move aims to encourage users to upgrade to *Windows 11* ahead of Windows 10 support ending on October 14, 2025.

items.title: Philips Hue raises US prices due to tariffs
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: - *Philips Hue* is increasing prices in the US starting July 1 *due to tariffs* imposed on Chinese imports. - Prices of products like the *Hue Play Wall Washer* and *Smart Button* have already risen compared to Europe. - The company warns future price hikes may occur if additional tariffs take effect, challenging customers to consider *more affordable alternatives*.

items.title: Fire TV Stick 4K Half Off Ahead of Prime Day
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: - The *Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K* is currently available for *$24.99*, half off, ahead of Prime Day on July 8th. - It supports *4K streaming*, Dolby Vision, HDR10 Plus, Dolby Atmos, and Alexa integration. - It also offers *cloud gaming* via Xbox Game Pass and Amazon Luna with compatible controllers.

items.title: Nomad's MagSafe Wallet Integrates Tracking Card
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Nomad's new Leather Mag Wallet integrates its *tracking card electronics* inside the wallet's frame, eliminating the need for a separate card slot.
- The wallet is *just 9mm thick*, holds up to four cards securely, and offers *5 months battery life* with wireless charging.
- Compatible with Apple's *Find My network* and MagSafe, but lacks ultra wideband, relying on an audible alarm for close location.

items.title: Roblox Introduces New Rewards to Boost Creator Engagement
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Roblox launches **Creator Rewards** starting July 24th to incentivize creators for player retention and user growth.
- The **Daily Engagement Reward** pays 5 Robux per active spender spending 10+ minutes in a creator's experience, promoting regular play.
- The **Audience Expansion Reward** offers a 35% revenue share for new or returning users driven by creators, potentially increasing creator earnings beyond existing programs.

items.title: Nvidia Launches RTX 5050 GPU with Varied VRAM for Desktop and Laptop
items.author: Antonio G. Di Benedetto
items.summary: - Nvidia announced the GeForce RTX 5050 GPUs for desktops and laptops, supporting *ray tracing* and *DLSS 4*. - Desktop RTX 5050 starts at **$249**, uses 8GB *GDDR6* VRAM, while the laptop version starts at **$999** with *8GB GDDR7* VRAM. - RTX 5050 offers roughly *60% faster performance than the RTX 3050* and aims for immersive ray-traced gaming experiences.

items.title: Anthropic wins fair use ruling for training AI on purchased books
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- A federal judge ruled that *training AI models on legally purchased physical books* is *fair use*, marking a significant legal victory for Anthropic and the AI industry.
- The ruling is *limited* to physical books Anthropic bought and digitized, excluding *pirated digital books*, which require a separate trial.
- The case does *not address copyright infringement* of AI-generated outputs, leaving other legal questions unresolved.

items.title: Nintendo’s wheelchair basketball game releases in August
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary: - *Drag x Drive*, a 3v3 wheelchair basketball game, will launch on August 14th exclusively for the Switch 2. - It highlights the Switch 2's new *mouse controls* that simulate wheelchair maneuvering. - This adds to the Switch 2’s growing lineup of *first-party exclusives* alongside titles like *Mario Kart World* and *Donkey Kong Bananza*.

items.title: Microsoft planning ‘major’ Xbox layoffs next week
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- **Microsoft is planning significant layoffs** in its Xbox gaming division as early as next week, along with job cuts in other parts of the company.
- The layoffs are part of a broader restructuring ahead of the next generation of Xbox consoles and involve changes to Xbox distribution in central Europe.
- These cuts follow multiple rounds of layoffs over the past 18 months, including over 6,000 job cuts in May and studio closures within the Xbox and Activision Blizzard groups.

items.title: Android’s youthful new design changes call handling
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google’s Phone app gains a fresh interface aligned with *Material 3 Expressive* design to simplify calls and contacts.
- Bottom menu now has three tabs: *Home*, *Keypad*, and *Voicemail*, with the Home tab showing favorites as bubbles and individual call entries.
- A new horizontal swipe gesture to answer or decline calls aims to reduce accidental actions.

items.title: I skipped every Death Stranding cutscene and I’ll do it again
items.author: Cameron Faulkner
items.summary:
- The author completed *Death Stranding* by skipping all cutscenes, which felt too slow and clashed with the game's engaging physics-based gameplay.
- Skipping cutscenes allowed a faster focus on exploration and traversal, highlighting the game’s clever design and humor.
- The author plans to use the same approach for *Death Stranding 2*, emphasizing gameplay over storyline cinematics.

items.title: Google DeepMind’s AI model now runs directly on robots offline
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google DeepMind released an *on-device version* of its Gemini Robotics AI model that operates *without internet*, enabling robots to perform complex physical tasks offline.
- The new model, though smaller and less powerful than the flagship hybrid model, can adapt to new tasks with as few as *50-100 demonstrations* and works on multiple robot types.
- An SDK is now available for developers to evaluate and fine-tune this model, aimed at applications needing *low connectivity* or *high security* environments.

items.title: What a set of knockoff headphones taught me about headphones — and knockoffs
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: - The Picun F8 Pro headphones, a convincing AirPods Max knockoff sold via TikTok Shop, sound slightly worse but offer some preferable features at a fraction of the price. - While Apple’s AirPods Max excel in design, noise-cancellation, and usability, Picun wins on comfort, battery life, and cost-effectiveness. - This highlights a growing trend where social media-driven purchasing blurs lines between ads and reviews, making knockoffs a tempting and accessible alternative.

items.title: Amazon bringing same-day delivery to millions of rural customers
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary: - Amazon will offer **same-day and next-day delivery** to over 4,000 small towns and rural communities by the end of 2026, expanding from 1,000 areas currently served. - This expansion covers **everyday essentials** with unlimited free same-day delivery for Prime members spending over $25. - The $4 billion investment includes new facilities, more drivers, and machine learning to stock popular local items for faster delivery.

items.title: TP-Link’s New Tapo 4K & HybridCams with 24/7 Battery Recording
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary: - TP-Link launched *Tapo 4K-capable security cameras* including solar-powered, battery-backed MagCam and VistaCam models with *24/7 recording* at lower frame rates to save power. - The new *HomeBase H500 hub* supports *local facial recognition*, *expanded local storage* (up to 16TB), and acts as a *Matter controller* for integrating various smart home devices. - HybridCam series adds *affordable 2K plug-in cameras* with AI detection and advanced tracking, expanding Tapo’s smart security ecosystem.

items.title: Tesla’s Robotaxi Reality Check
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary: - Tesla has launched a limited *robotaxi service* in one area with few cars and safety monitors, highlighting a cautious approach in self-driving development. - Despite this launch, *Tesla’s autonomous vehicle ambitions remain in early stages*, with uncertainty about future growth. - The podcast also discusses *cell service competition* with MVNOs and practical tips to *free up iPhone storage*.

items.title: 8BitDo’s Controllers Now Compatible with Nintendo Switch 2
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary: - 8BitDo released a firmware update making eight of its flagship controllers *compatible* with the Nintendo Switch 2. - Compatible models include the Ultimate 2, Pro 2, SN30 Pro, USB Wireless Adapters, Arcade Controller, and Arcade Stick. - Firmware updates can be installed via 8BitDo’s multi-platform software apps for PC, macOS, Android, and iOS.

items.title: A week with Meta Quest 3S Xbox Edition VR headset
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- The Meta Quest 3S Xbox Edition VR headset is a $399 device co-branded by Microsoft and Meta, featuring Xbox-style black and green design and pre-paired Xbox controller.
- It streams Xbox Cloud Gaming through the Xbox app with a 26-foot virtual display and includes three months of Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscription.
- The immersive experience shows some streaming quality limits but offers a portable all-in-one gaming solution without the need for a console.

items.title: AT&T simplifies sending pictures to 911 dispatchers
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- AT&T's ESInet platform update, launching in October, enables easy picture and video sharing with 911 dispatchers to improve emergency response.
- Over 1,700 centers have upgraded to this fiber-based IP network, enhancing call processing reliability.
- The update includes cybersecurity features and integration with select 2026 Toyota cars for automatic crash data transmission.

items.title: Google Earth adds historical Street View imagery and AI-driven environmental insights
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary: - *Google Earth* now features *historical Street View imagery*, allowing users to see how locations have changed over time, similar to Google Maps. - The update coincides with Google Earth's *20th anniversary*. - Upcoming features include *AI-driven environmental insights* for professionals, such as *tree canopy coverage* and *land surface temperature* data to identify shaded and hotter urban areas.

items.title: How AI Infiltrated Perfume
items.author: Arabelle Sicardi
items.summary: - *Osmo* is a startup using AI to digitize scents, enabling *custom perfumes* with a 48-hour turnaround, revolutionizing the traditionally slow fragrance creation process. - Major fragrance companies like *Givaudan* and *DSM-Firmenich* integrate AI to aid perfumers, blending technology with creativity. - Concerns remain over *loss of craftsmanship*, *environmental impact*, and *transparency* in AI-created scents, raising questions about *authenticity and ethics* in perfumery.

items.title: Waymo robotaxis launch on Uber app in Atlanta
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- *Waymo’s driverless robotaxis are now available exclusively via the Uber app in Atlanta*, marking the city as the second market after Austin for this autonomous ridehail service.
- The service operates within a 65-square-mile area covering central neighborhoods and excludes highways and airport trips for now.
- *Uber manages fleet maintenance,* while Waymo oversees vehicle testing and roadside support, sharing costs and revenue with undisclosed splits.

items.title: Verizon adopts Google’s Gemini AI to enhance customer service
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary: - Verizon launched an *AI-powered Assistant* in the My Verizon app to handle upgrades, billing, and more, aiming to streamline customer service efficiently. - The AI, developed with Google, achieves *90% accuracy* with personalized language models reducing errors. - A new 'Customer Champion,' leveraging Google’s Gemini AI, will assist with *complex issues*, supported by expanded 24/7 live chat and agent availability.

items.title: Riot is shutting down studio behind its Minecraft-like game
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: - Riot Games is closing Hypixel Studios, the developer behind *Hytale*, a Minecraft-like game in development since 2015. - Despite years of work and a 2020 acquisition by Riot, *Hytale*'s technical challenges delayed its release, ultimately leading to the shutdown. - The popular Hypixel Minecraft server will remain unaffected, and Riot is supporting the impacted team members with severance and resources.

items.title: Windows 11 Volume and Brightness Indicators Can Be Moved
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary: - Windows 11 Dev Channel now allows **moving hardware indicator pop-ups** (volume, brightness) to the top-left or top-center of the screen. - A **new Recall homepage** shows your recent activity and top-used apps/websites in 24 hours. - These features are in testing and will roll out to the public in upcoming Windows 11 updates.

items.title: Raleigh One e-bike launches with VanMoof DNA
OpenAI’s first AI device with Jony Ive won’t be a wearable
Yale Smart Lock with Matter Launches at Higher Price Due to Tariffs
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary:
- The Yale Smart Lock with Matter launches June 24th at $189.99, priced $20 higher due to tariffs.
- It features Matter-over-Thread connectivity for fast response and supports multiple platforms including Google Home, Apple Home, and Amazon Alexa.
- Key highlights include remote unlocking with voice PIN, a backlit keypad with key access, and integration with Google Nest doorbells, but no security system integration at launch.

items.title: Samsung confirms Unpacked for early July
T-Mobile’s satellite service officially launches in July
Nintendo’s GameCube controller for the Switch 2 is back in stock
items.author: Brandon Russell
items.summary:
- Nintendo’s updated **GameCube Controller** for the Switch 2 is available again for **$64.99** with a Nintendo Switch Online subscription required.  
- It features **wireless connectivity**, a **GameChat button** for voice chat, and a **capture button** for screenshots.  
- Best suited for **GameCube titles** on the Switch Online Expansion Pack but usable with other Switch 2 games despite missing some buttons.

items.title: Phew: Apple fixed the Finder icon in macOS Tahoe 26
The Steam Deck OLED is back in stock
Trump’s FTC will approve an ad merger — with a gift to Elon Musk’s X
Hue Releases Larger, Pricier Smart Button
items.author: Jennifer Pattison Tuohy
items.summary: - Philips Hue launched a new *Smart Button* that is *larger* (45mm diameter) and *costs more* in the U.S. at $32.99 vs. $29.99 previously. - Functionality remains the same, but design shifts to a flatter shape with a small magnetic wall plate instead of a larger one. - U.S. customers face potential *price hikes* as early as July 1, possibly due to tariffs, while EU and UK prices remain lower.

items.title: Apple heard your complaints about the Liquid Glass Control Center
New York’s getting a new nuclear power plant
Apple’s USB-C EarPods are an even better buy at just $15.99
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary: - Apple’s USB-C EarPods, released in 2023, are a budget-friendly $15.99 on Amazon and Walmart, making them a smart replacement or upgrade for iPhone users. - They offer *clear sound* and *outperform some pricier wireless earbuds* in mic quality. - The *wired design ensures no lag or battery worries*, ideal for low-maintenance use.

items.title: Here are the best Apple Watch deals available right now
Microsoft’s Xbox UI update lets you pin games and customize your homescreen
House bans WhatsApp on government devices over security concerns
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- The House of Representatives has prohibited staff from using *WhatsApp* on government devices, citing it as *high-risk* due to *lack of data protection transparency* and *security issues*.
- Meta disputed the claim, emphasizing WhatsApp's *default end-to-end encryption* as offering superior security.
- Alternatives suggested include *Microsoft Teams*, *Signal*, and *iMessage*; TikTok and free ChatGPT versions are also restricted on government devices.

items.title: Nintendo’s Switch 2 Now Available Online at Best Buy
items.author: Brandt Ranj
items.summary: - The highly sought-after Nintendo Switch 2 is *restocking* online only at Best Buy with limited availability. - It is the *fastest-selling console* ever with 3.5 million sold in four days since launch. - Switch 2 offers *backwards compatibility* and better performance on many original Switch games, making it an enhanced hybrid console.
